block.p: Carolyn Ann Koegler, a daughter of Mary Ellen Scarborough of Bronxville, N.Y., and the late Kurt G. Koegler, is to be married today to Robert Harrex Miller, the son of Monique Miller and Dr. Robert M. Miller of Manchester, N.H. Judge Robert W. Sweet of the Federal District Court for the Southern District, is to officiate at the American Yacht Club in Rye, N.Y.

The bride and bridegroom, both 28, are associates at New Hampshire law firms, she at Sulloway & Hollis in Concord and he at Sheehan, Phinney, Bass & Green in Manchester. The bride, a cum laude graduate of Tufts University, and the bridegroom, who graduated from Yale University, received their law degrees from the University of Pennsylvania.

Carolyn Ann Koegler, a daughter of Mary Ellen Scarborough of Bronxville, N.Y., and the late Kurt G. Koegler, is to be married today to Robert Harrex Miller, the son of Monique Miller and Dr. Robert M. Miller of Manchester, N.H. Judge Robert W. Sweet of the Federal District Court for the Southern District, is to officiate at the American Yacht Club in Rye, N.Y.

The bride and bridegroom, both 28, are associates at New Hampshire law firms, she at Sulloway & Hollis in Concord and he at Sheehan, Phinney, Bass & Green in Manchester. The bride, a cum laude graduate of Tufts University, and the bridegroom, who graduated from Yale University, received their law degrees from the University of Pennsylvania.

The bride's mother is an administrative law judge for the New York City Finance Department. The bride's father retired as a partner in Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom, the New York law firm. The bride is a stepdaughter of Thomas B. Reddy and of Louise Koegler of Wilson, Wyo.
The bridegroom is the author of ''Law School Confidential,'' a primer to be published by St. Martin's Press. His father, a retired dentist, practiced in Manchester.
